title: This Innovative Steel Bed Frame Made My Back Pain Disappear
author: Mark Marino
text: DecoratingFurnitureShoppingWe independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.Sure, choosing the right mattress is key to a good night’s sleep, but picking the right bed frame is equally important. A badly made one can be wobbly, creaky, cause your mattress to sag, and worst of all, wreak havoc on your back. So, how do you find a quality bed frame? Well, Australian company Sleeping Duck set out to make it easy by developing the Indestruct Bed, a super sturdy frame with a chassis made from structural steel (aka the really strong kind used in construction!) to provide superior spine support.In other words, you can say bye-bye to back pain. We had the chance to test the Indestruct Bed for ourselves, and as it turns out, it really is a dream come true. A Quick Look at the Sleeping Duck Indestruct Bed  Comes in Queen, King, and California King sizes. Chassis crafted from indestructible structural steel that can bear 5,000 pounds of weight. Solid steel C-Beams provide individualized back support. Customizable with fabric panels in charcoal, stone, or ivory or timber panels in European oak, European ash, or American walnut; optional headboard available in same colors. Legs available in 5.9” and 7.9” heights. 100-night satisfaction guarantee or your money back. Design Features That Stand OutOur tester, Ethan, had been sleeping for years on an unsteady, inexpensive bed frame from a big-box store, so the Indestruct Bed was definitely a major upgrade (especially since his old frame finally broke days before the Indestruct Bed arrived). The first thing he noticed after putting the new queen-size frame together was how sleek and sturdy it is. “It’s very solid and nice looking,” he says of the Indestruct Bed. “When I tried to shake the headboard or sides, it didn’t have any give.”Ethan customized the base of his bed with timber panels and a headboard in the brand’s European ash color. The solid wood is “thick and heavy,” he says. “Definitely high quality.” Ethan also opted for tall legs for the frame — a smart move, since they allow more space for underbed storage to help his room stay clutter-free.How It PerformedThough the bed’s core is made of steel, it wasn’t too heavy or difficult to assemble. The instructions were easy to follow, Ethan says, and everything came together in about three hours. While Ethan assembled the bed by himself, he admits that “it definitely would have been easier with two people.”Regardless, it was worth the time and effort: The Indestruct Bed has been a complete game-changer since Ethan began sleeping on it two months ago. His previous bed frame was wobbly and creaky, and he frequently woke up in the morning with a sore back. The Indestruct Bed, however, remains still and silent while he sleeps, and he feels much more well rested as a result. More importantly, he hasn’t experienced any back pain since making the switch to the Indestruct Bed. “My body definitely feels more supported, no matter what position I sleep in,” he says. “I wish I had found this frame sooner!”What We Loved  It’s super sturdy. This stylish steel bed doesn’t budge while you slumber, so you know it’s built to last.  It’s customizable. The panels and headboard come in a variety of stylish options to suit any decor. Bonus points to Sleeping Duck for providing two leg height options for those who need extra storage space. It’s so supportive. The steel C-Beams in the chassis are positioned under the spine of each sleeper for ultimate back support. Good to KnowPrices for the Indestruct Bed vary, starting at $1,099 for a simple queen-size frame with fabric panels and standard legs. Timber panels cost an additional $200, tall legs are an extra $100, and a headboard can be purchased for $500. Through February 18, Sleeping Duck is offering $150 off sitewide with code PRESIDENT150.Should You Buy the Sleeping Duck Indestruct Bed?The Sleeping Duck Indestruct Bed is a bit of an investment, but definitely worth it if you’re looking for a bed that is: Built to last a lifetime Incredibly supportive and combats back pain Stylish and customizable Where to Buy the Sleeping Duck Indestruct BedSleeping Duck, $1,899 for queen size with timber panels and headboard; use code PRESIDENT150 to save $150 off sitewide.HOW WE SHOP FOR YOUOur writers and editors put hundreds of products to the test every year to determine which ones get our stamp of approval and are really worth your time and money. If we love it, you’ll hear about it. WHY YOU SHOULD TRUST USOur team is made up of writers and editors with years of experience in the home, kitchen, and parenting consumer product space, and who are always testing for new tried-and-true staples.HOW WE TEST PRODUCTSWe put products to the test right where they matter: at home. We bring these products into our personal spaces and test them for weeks and even months to see if they live up to their claims. At the end of the day, we’re consumers too, so we’ll provide you with all the information we’d want — and then some.Read more about our team and how we choose products.
html:
• Decorating
  • Furniture
  • Shopping

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

Sure, choosing the right mattress is key to a good night’s sleep, but picking the right bed frame is equally important. A badly made one can be wobbly, creaky, cause your mattress to sag, and worst of all, wreak havoc on your back. So, how do you find a quality bed frame? Well, Australian company Sleeping Duck set out to make it easy by developing the Indestruct Bed, a super sturdy frame with a chassis made from structural steel (aka the really strong kind used in construction!) to provide superior spine support.

In other words, you can say bye-bye to back pain. We had the chance to test the Indestruct Bed for ourselves, and as it turns out, it really is a dream come true. 

A Quick Look at the Sleeping Duck Indestruct Bed 

  • Comes in Queen, King, and California King sizes.
  • Chassis crafted from indestructible structural steel that can bear 5,000 pounds of weight.
  • Solid steel C-Beams provide individualized back support.
  • Customizable with fabric panels in charcoal, stone, or ivory or timber panels in European oak, European ash, or American walnut; optional headboard available in same colors.
  • Legs available in 5.9” and 7.9” heights.
  • 100-night satisfaction guarantee or your money back.

Design Features That Stand Out

Our tester, Ethan, had been sleeping for years on an unsteady, inexpensive bed frame from a big-box store, so the Indestruct Bed was definitely a major upgrade (especially since his old frame finally broke days before the Indestruct Bed arrived). The first thing he noticed after putting the new queen-size frame together was how sleek and sturdy it is. “It’s very solid and nice looking,” he says of the Indestruct Bed. “When I tried to shake the headboard or sides, it didn’t have any give.”

Ethan customized the base of his bed with timber panels and a headboard in the brand’s European ash color. The solid wood is “thick and heavy,” he says. “Definitely high quality.” Ethan also opted for tall legs for the frame — a smart move, since they allow more space for underbed storage to help his room stay clutter-free.

How It Performed

Though the bed’s core is made of steel, it wasn’t too heavy or difficult to assemble. The instructions were easy to follow, Ethan says, and everything came together in about three hours. While Ethan assembled the bed by himself, he admits that “it definitely would have been easier with two people.”

Regardless, it was worth the time and effort: The Indestruct Bed has been a complete game-changer since Ethan began sleeping on it two months ago. His previous bed frame was wobbly and creaky, and he frequently woke up in the morning with a sore back. The Indestruct Bed, however, remains still and silent while he sleeps, and he feels much more well rested as a result. More importantly, he hasn’t experienced any back pain since making the switch to the Indestruct Bed. “My body definitely feels more supported, no matter what position I sleep in,” he says. “I wish I had found this frame sooner!”

What We Loved 

  • It’s super sturdy. This stylish steel bed doesn’t budge while you slumber, so you know it’s built to last. 
  • It’s customizable. The panels and headboard come in a variety of stylish options to suit any decor. Bonus points to Sleeping Duck for providing two leg height options for those who need extra storage space.
  • It’s so supportive. The steel C-Beams in the chassis are positioned under the spine of each sleeper for ultimate back support.

Good to Know

Prices for the Indestruct Bed vary, starting at $1,099 for a simple queen-size frame with fabric panels and standard legs. Timber panels cost an additional $200, tall legs are an extra $100, and a headboard can be purchased for $500. Through February 18, Sleeping Duck is offering $150 off sitewide with code PRESIDENT150.

Should You Buy the Sleeping Duck Indestruct Bed?

The Sleeping Duck Indestruct Bed is a bit of an investment, but definitely worth it if you’re looking for a bed that is:

  • Built to last a lifetime
  • Incredibly supportive and combats back pain
  • Stylish and customizable

Where to Buy the Sleeping Duck Indestruct Bed

Sleeping Duck, $1,899 for queen size with timber panels and headboard; use code PRESIDENT150 to save $150 off sitewide.

HOW WE SHOP FOR YOU

Our writers and editors put hundreds of products to the test every year to determine which ones get our stamp of approval and are really worth your time and money. If we love it, you’ll hear about it. 

WHY YOU SHOULD TRUST US

HOW WE TEST PRODUCTS

We put products to the test right where they matter: at home. We bring these products into our personal spaces and test them for weeks and even months to see if they live up to their claims. At the end of the day, we’re consumers too, so we’ll provide you with all the information we’d want — and then some.
